channel.title: Basic foods for riotscape/pi PYTHON script explained for food
channel.description:
Okay, well you gotta use how riotscape was coded...
Edit the PYTHON scripts, its much faster.
In Data\scripts\player\eat\eat.py
add: [CODE]# chocolate cake def itemClick_1897(player, itemId, itemSlot): player.getPA().eatFood(5, 1600, itemId, itemSlot) # chocolate cake 2/3 def itemClick_1899(player, itemId, itemSlot): player.getPA().eatFood(5, 1600, itemId, itemSlot) # chocolate cake 1/3 def itemClick_1901(player, itemId, itemSlot): player.getPA().eatFood(5, 1600, itemId, itemSlot) # cake def itemClick_1891(player, itemId, itemSlot): player.getPA().eatFood(4, 1600, itemId, itemSlot) # cake 2/3 def itemClick_1893(player, itemId, itemSlot): player.getPA().eatFood(4, 1600, itemId, itemSlot) # cake 1/3 def itemClick_1895(player, itemId, itemSlot): player.getPA().eatFood(4, 1600, itemId, itemSlot)[/CODE]
EXPLANATION: The # (FOOD NAME GOES HERE) is a comment, to identify the food.
def itemClick_1895(player, itemId, itemSlot): means that when you click the item, itemClick_FOOD ID NUMBER it finds the player, item id, and item slot
player.getPA().eatFood(4, 1600, itemId, itemSlot) the 4 is the amount it heals.
and in Food.java add:
[CODE]CAKE(1901,7,"Choclate Cake"), CAKEH(1893,5,"Half Cake"), CAKEHZ(1891,5,"Cake"), CAKES(1895,5,"One Slice Cake"), SCAKEH(1899,7,"Half Chocolate Cake"), SCAKE(1897,7,"One Slice Cake"), SHRIMP(315,3,"Shrimp"),[/CODE]
add those above : TUNA_POTATO(7060,22,"Tuna Potato");
EXPLANATION: A sample to explane it: [CODE]SCAKEH(1899,7,"Half Chocolate Cake"),[/CODE] the 1899 is the id of the Cake, like 390 is manta ray item id. 7 is the amount it heals in hitpoints. the "Half Chocolate Cake" Is so when it says " You eat the ()" The () Says what you put in the quotations
Now, there is more if you want full Cakes, I can add them later by request. Anyway
credits: sanity mj2000 hayzie & lmctruck for original source

item.title: Basic foods for riotscape/pi PYTHON script explained for food
item.dc:creator: @Pouch Pouch
item.description:
@Pouch wrote:

Okay, well you gotta use how riotscape was coded…

Edit the PYTHON scripts, its much faster.

In Data\scripts\player\eat\eat.py

add:

[CODE]# chocolate cake
def itemClick_1897(player, itemId, itemSlot):
player.getPA().eatFood(5, 1600, itemId, itemSlot)

chocolate cake 2/3

def itemClick_1899(player, itemId, itemSlot):
player.getPA().eatFood(5, 1600, itemId, itemSlot)

chocolate cake 1/3

def itemClick_1901(player, itemId, itemSlot):
player.getPA().eatFood(5, 1600, itemId, itemSlot)

cake

def itemClick_1891(player, itemId, itemSlot):
player.getPA().eatFood(4, 1600, itemId, itemSlot)

cake 2/3

def itemClick_1893(player, itemId, itemSlot):
player.getPA().eatFood(4, 1600, itemId, itemSlot)

cake 1/3

def itemClick_1895(player, itemId, itemSlot):
player.getPA().eatFood(4, 1600, itemId, itemSlot)[/CODE]

EXPLANATION:
The # (FOOD NAME GOES HERE) is a comment, to identify the food.

def itemClick_1895(player, itemId, itemSlot): means that when you click the item, itemClick_FOOD ID NUMBER it finds the player, item id, and item slot

player.getPA().eatFood(4, 1600, itemId, itemSlot) the 4 is the amount it heals.

and in Food.java add:

CAKE(1901,7,"Choclate Cake"), CAKEH(1893,5,"Half Cake"), CAKEHZ(1891,5,"Cake"), CAKES(1895,5,"One Slice Cake"), SCAKEH(1899,7,"Half Chocolate Cake"), SCAKE(1897,7,"One Slice Cake"), SHRIMP(315,3,"Shrimp"),

add those above :
TUNA_POTATO(7060,22,“Tuna Potato”);

EXPLANATION:
A sample to explane it:

SCAKEH(1899,7,"Half Chocolate Cake"),

the 1899 is the id of the Cake, like 390 is manta ray item id.
7 is the amount it heals in hitpoints.
the “Half Chocolate Cake” Is so when it says " You eat the ()"
The () Says what you put in the quotations

Now, there is more if you want full Cakes, I can add them later by request.
Anyway

credits:
sanity
mj2000
hayzie & lmctruck for original source
